hackathon-judges.judge-role: Partnerships and Strategic Initiatives, Web3 Foundation
Impact Policy Manager, Blockchain for Social Impact

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: 0x will award two prizes. One prize to the team with the most innovative of the of 0x protocol (Most Innovative Product), and one prize to the team with the most compelling prototype using the 0x protocol (Best Product Execution). The prize for both winning teams will be $2,500 in ZRX tokens.

A total of up to 3 ETH will be awarded by Aragon. The aragonOS framework enables fully upgradeable DApps and puts a strong emphasis on governance and re-usability. Aragon is awarding three prizes for building with it: Best Aragon App or Integration (two prizes) and Best Proposal (one prize).
Bounties.network is offering 1 ETH to the team that builds your own bounty network. For more information, see this post:
Cellarius is offering 4 prizes at for a total of $5000. They are:

CryptoKitties is offering two prizes: [1st Place: 1ETH + 1 gen0 CryptoKitty. 2nd Place: 0.5ETH + 1 gen1 CryptoKitty] Projects will be judged on: Use of ERC 721, Originality, User Interface, Simplicity in Design, Technical Complexity, WOW factor. We're especially excited by teams who have creative ideas in the blockchain space and who think outside the box in terms of art on the blockchain, with focus on extensibility, personalization or interactivity.
DAOStack is offering 3 prizes for a total of $5000 in ETH. Please find a full description of DAOstack's ETHDenver bounties at
Two prizes, $750 each! Helping absentee voting and reducing processing overhead. See more details here:

Dharma is offering one prize worth 3 ETH to the best application built on top of Dharma protocol at the event. Projects will be evaluated based on their creativity and impact on the decentralized financial ecosystem.
ERC dEX will award 888 ZRX to the person/team that best utilizes the Aqueduct SDK (
Gitcoin is offering 5 ETH across a variety of bounties! The long form descriptions for our bounties are available at
IBN will award one $1500 prize for the team to produce the most intuitive, effective and enjoyable User Experience.
A total of up to 5 MKR will be awarded to the team that best utilizes Dai in their application. We are looking for innovative use cases and solid MVP’s. See more details here:

2.5ETH for each prize, 4 prizes total. Prizes given for: 1) Most innovative use of the NuCypher KMS protocol (2x); 2) Most compelling/prototype implementation of an app using the NuCypher KMS protocol (2x). More info on Github
POA will award three prizes ($3000, $2000 and $1000 in POA tokens) to the teams with the most innovative use cases, solid MVPs and that best utilize the POA Network.
Offering $1,000 to the project most likely to give power back to a marginalized group.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Power to the People (Sponsored by Steven McKie/Amentum)

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Status will award 1.5 ETH across 4 prizes. The first two bounties will be based in our go-ethereum fork and be discussed at the event; the second two will be aimed at developers wanting to create DApps for mobile or an interesting use-case for the ethereum blockchain. You can find out more about our bounty tracks at our booth at ETHDenver, and they will be posted as issues through our GitHub
API PRIZE: $1500 USD in STORJ tokens (across 3 teams).
Toshi is offering one 1.5 ETH prize for the Best Mobile Compatible DApp. Requirements:
1.5 ETH, divided in three ways among:

ETHDenver does not have an overall 1st, 2nd, and 3rd place team. Instead, we will have 7 judging groups. Each group will select a 1st place and 2nd place team. The top 7 teams will be celebrated on stage!

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: What type of technical challenges did the group deal with? (Coding or non-coding challenges.)
How unique and innovative is the demo? Has it been seen at previous hackathons?
How useful is this demo, based on the problem they are trying to solve?
How good is the visual design and interaction experience?
Will this demo equalize the playing field rather than perpetuate existing inequities? Does it lead us towards a better society and a blockchain culture that reflects the diversity of the world?

hackathon-description-header: Connect, learn, and #buidl with those who are shaping the decentralized future.
